source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 4 of MG_HW10: Annotate anvio gene calls for function and taxonomy
source_data.protocol_name: MG_HW10: Annotate anvio gene calls for function and taxonomy
source_data.protocol_name_html: MG_HW10: Annotate anvio gene calls for function and taxonomy
source_data.annotation:
PC users

 

When you scp your files using Cygwin, move those files to a new folder in Documents. Then in docker quickstart terminal navigate to that folder and do pwd to get the full path. Then to launch Anvio:

 

docker run --rm -v /path/to/files:/my_data -p 8080:8080 -it meren/anvio:latest

 

Additional troubleshooting- if having issues do docker ps and see if there are existing sessions. If so do docker kill [session id]
source_data.thread_text:

Additional troubleshooting- if having issues do docker ps and see if there are existing sessions. If so do docker kill [session id]

When you scp your files using Cygwin, move those files to a new folder in Documents. Then in docker quickstart terminal navigate to that folder and do pwd to get the full path. Then to launch Anvio:

Additional troubleshooting- if having issues do docker ps and see if there are existing sessions. If so do docker kill [session id]

source_data.annotation: Windows users have to do this from Cygwin/Putty, not the Docker image for Anvi'o. For Cygwin you have to move/copy nucleotides.faa to C:/cygwin64/home/User/ then perform the above command in a terminal NOT logged into the HPC.

components.data: Go to the taxonomy-genes directory
components.name: Section

components.data: Create the following script to run taxonomic analysis on the gene calls from Anvi'o.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Create the following script to run taxonomic analysis on the gene calls from Anvi'o.

components.data: Create the centrifuge_tax.sh script
components.name: Section

source_data.name:
#!/bin/bash

#PBS -W group_list=bh_class
#PBS -q windfall
#PBS -l jobtype=cluster_only
#PBS -l select=1:ncpus=12:mem=23gb
#PBS -l pvmem=22gb
#PBS -l walltime=24:00:00
#PBS -l cput=24:00:00
#PBS -M netid@email.arizona.edu
#PBS -m bea

#--------------EDIT THESE---------------
FASTA="/rsgrps/bh_class/username/anvio-genes/nucleotides.faa"
OUT_DIR="/rsgrps/bh_class/username/taxonomy-genes"
#---------------------------------------

CENT_DB="/rsgrps/bh_class/b_compressed+h+v/b_compressed+h+v"

centrifuge -x $CENT_DB -U $FASTA -S $OUT_DIR/centrifuge_hits.tsv --report-file $OUT_DIR/centrifuge_report.tsv -f

components.data: Run the centrifuge_tax.sh script to get the taxonomic information for genes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run the centrifuge_tax.sh script to get the taxonomic information for genes.

components.data: Run the centrifuge_tax.sh script
components.name: Section

source_data.name:
chmod 755 centrifuge_tax.sh
qsub -o std-out/ -e std-err/ centrifuge_tax.sh

11/20 Ocelote doesn't work for qsub, Cluster/HTC/SMP seems to be working

___________________

I'm now having errors for even submitting- anyone else? 

 

When I log on to Ocelote and go to folder to run, this is the response:

qsub: Job rejected by all possible destinations

 

When I log on to sftp hpc 

-bash: qsub: command not found

11/20 Ocelote doesn't work for qsub, Cluster/HTC/SMP seems to be working

___________________

I'm now having errors for even submitting- anyone else?

source_data.name:
#!/bin/bash

#PBS -W group_list=bh_class
#PBS -q windfall
#PBS -l jobtype=cluster_only
#PBS -l select=1:ncpus=12:mem=23gb
#PBS -l pvmem=22gb
#PBS -l walltime=24:00:00
#PBS -l cput=24:00:00
#PBS -M netid@email.arizona.edu
#PBS -m bea

#--------------EDIT THESE---------------
FASTA="/rsgrps/bh_class/username/anvio-genes/nucleotides.faa"
OUT_DIR="/rsgrps/bh_class/username/function-genes"
OUTPUT="$OUT_DIR/uproc-out"
#---------------------------------------

export UPROC="/rsgrps/bh_class/bin/uproc-dna"
export DATA="/rsgrps/bh_class/data/uproc"
export UPROC_MODEL="$DATA/model"
export UPROC_OUT_DIR="$OUT_DIR/uproc-out"
export PFAM="$DATA/pfam27ready"
export KEGG="$DATA/keggready"


$UPROC --preds --short --threads 12 --output $OUTPUT.pfam $PFAM $UPROC_MODEL $FASTA

$UPROC --preds --short --threads 12 --output $OUTPUT.kegg $KEGG $UPROC_MODEL $FASTA

source_data.section: Convert the functional data into anvio format

components.data: Run format-anvio.pl to convert the functional data into anvio format.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run format-anvio.pl to convert the functional data into anvio format.

components.data: Run format-anvio.pl
components.name: Section

source_data.name:
chmod 755 format-anvio.pl
./format-anvio.pl uproc-out.kegg /rsgrps/bh_class/kegg_to_desc uproc-kegg-anvio kegg
./format-anvio.pl uproc-out.pfam /rsgrps/bh_class/pfam_to_domain uproc-pfam-anvio pfam
cat uproc-kegg-anvio > input_matrix.txt
egrep -v "gene_callers_id" uproc-pfam-anvio >> input_matrix.txt

source_data.annotation:
Hello,

 

You need to make a soft link from /usr/username/ on your MINGW environment to when you launch docker, here is the command:

 

$ docker run --rm -v ~:/my_data/ -it meren/anvio:latest

 

In here when I launch the Docker image on my desktop and type the above command on the prompt, I can see a soft link directory named "my_data" which gives me access to all the files I copied from HPC to my local machine, from that directory you can execute all the Anvio functionality.
source_data.thread_text:

You need to make a soft link from /usr/username/ on your MINGW environment to when you launch docker, here is the command:

source_data.body:
Hello,

 

You need to make a soft link from /usr/username/ on your MINGW environment to when you launch docker, here is the command:

 

$ docker run --rm -v ~:/my_data/ -it meren/anvio:latest

 

In here when I launch the Docker image on my desktop and type the above command on the prompt, I can see a soft link directory named "my_data" which gives me access to all the files I copied from HPC to my local machine, from that directory you can execute all the Anvio functionality.

components.data: Please document these steps in the methods section of your report.  Note what programs you used for each step and what the parameters were.  How many genes did Anvi'o find?  Is this different from your analyses?  Why?  Anvi'o uses the "-p meta" parameter for metagenomics datasets, which is stricter than what you first ran.  How many of your genes from Anvio had a match to a known bacteria?  How many matched known proteins for kegg or pfam?
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Please document these steps in the methods section of your report.  Note what programs you used for each step and what the parameters were.  How many genes did Anvi'o find?  Is this different from your analyses?  Why?  Anvi'o uses the "-p meta" parameter for metagenomics datasets, which is stricter than what you first ran.  How many of your genes from Anvio had a match to a known bacteria?  How many matched known proteins for kegg or pfam?
